title: Hurry_Up_Tomorrow
extract: Hurry Up Tomorrow is the sixth and potentially final studio album by Canadian singer-songwriter the Weeknd. It was released through XO and Republic Records on January 31, 2025. The album contains guest appearances from Justice, Anitta, Travis Scott, Florence and the Machine, Future, Playboi Carti, Giorgio Moroder, and Lana Del Rey. Production was primarily handled by the Weeknd himself and Mike Dean, with Justice and Giorgio Morocer themselves, DaHeala, Metro Boomin, Max Martin, Oscar Holter, OPN, Cirkut, and TBHits also being involved. Hurry Up Tomorrow is a synth-pop and R&B album.

'''''Hurry Up Tomorrow''''' is the sixth and potentially final<ref>{{Cite web |last=Aswad |first=Jem |date=2025-01-10 |title=The Weeknd on the ‘Breakdown’ That Inspired His ‘Hurry Up Tomorrow’ Album and Film, and Why He Might Retire the Weeknd: ‘It Never Ends Until You End It’ |url=https://variety.com/2025/music/news/the-weeknd-hurry-up-tomorrow-interview-ending-career-1236268897/ |access-date=2025-02-04 |website=Variety |language=en-US}}</ref> studio album by Canadian singer-songwriter [[the Weeknd]]. It was released through [[XO (record label)|XO]] and [[Republic Records]] on January 31, 2025. The album contains guest appearances from [[Justice (band)|Justice]], [[Anitta (singer)|Anitta]], [[Travis Scott]], [[Florence and the Machine]], [[Future (rapper)|Future]], [[Playboi Carti]], [[Giorgio Moroder]], and [[Lana Del Rey]].<ref name="Aswad">{{cite magazine |last=Aswad |first=Jem |date=January 30, 2025 |title=The Weeknd Drops New Album, 'Hurry Up Tomorrow,' Featuring Lana Del Rey, Travis Scott, Future and More |url=https://variety.com/2025/music/news/the-weeknd-drops-hurry-up-tomorrow-featuring-lana-del-rey-travis-scott-future-1236292214/ |magazine=Variety |access-date=January 31, 2025 |language=en-US}}</ref> Production was primarily handled by the Weeknd himself and [[Mike Dean (producer)|Mike Dean]], with Justice and Giorgio Morocer themselves, [[DaHeala]], [[Metro Boomin]], [[Max Martin]], [[Oscar Holter]], [[Oneohtrix Point Never|OPN]], [[Cirkut]], and [[Tommy Brown (record producer)|TBHits]] also being involved. ''Hurry Up Tomorrow'' is a [[synth-pop]] and [[contemporary R&B|R&B]] album.<ref name="NME">{{Cite web|url=https://www.nme.com/reviews/album/the-weeknd-hurry-up-tomorrow-review-3833573|title=The Weeknd – 'Hurry Up Tomorrow' review: stadium-filling superstar prepares to move on|date=January 31, 2025|first=Nick|last=Levine|work=[[NME]]|access-date=January 31, 2025}}</ref><ref name="independent">{{cite news |last=O'Connor |first=Roisin |date=January 31, 2025 |title=On Hurry Up Tomorrow, The Weeknd delivers a spectacular final chapter in his 'After Hours' trilogy |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/arts-entertainment/music/reviews/the-weeknd-hurry-up-tomorrow-review-features-lyrics-b2689689.html |work=The Independent |access-date=January 31, 2025}}</ref><ref name="telegraph">{{cite news |last1=McCormick |first1=Neil |last2=Perry |first2=Andrew |last3=Platt |first3=Poppie |date=January 31, 2025 |title=The Weeknd's epic Hurry Up Tomorrow is one of the most depressing albums in pop history |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/music/news/the-weekend-hurry-up-tomorrow-review/ |work=The Daily Telegraph |access-date=January 31, 2025}}</ref>

title: Dick_Button
extract: Richard Totten Button was an American figure skater and skating analyst. He was a two-time Olympic champion and five-time consecutive world champion (1948–1952). He was also the only non-European man to have become European champion. Button is credited as having been the first skater to successfully land the double Axel jump in competition in 1948, as well as the first triple jump of any kind – a triple loop – in 1952. He also invented the flying camel spin, which was originally known as the "Button camel". He "brought increased athleticism" to figure skating in the years following World War II. According to figure skating historian James R. Hines, Button represented the "American School" of figure skating, which was a more athletic style than skaters from Europe.
trending_reason: The Dick Button article is trending on Wikipedia following the figure skater's recent death on January 30, 2025, marking the end of an era for a celebrated Olympic champion and influential figure in the sport.

title: The_Weeknd
extract: Abel Makkonen Tesfaye, known professionally as the Weeknd, is a Canadian singer-songwriter and actor. Recognized for his unconventional musical production, artistic reinventions, and falsetto register, Tesfaye is regarded as highly innovative and influential. His accolades include four Grammy Awards, 20 Billboard Music Awards, 22 Juno Awards, six American Music Awards, three MTV Video Music Awards, a Latin Grammy Award and nominations for an Academy Award and a Primetime Emmy Award.
trending_reason: The Weeknd article is trending on Wikipedia following the recent release of his highly anticipated album "Hurry Up Tomorrow," which has generated significant buzz and discussion in the music community.

title: Stanley_Green
extract: Stanley Owen Green, known as the "Protein Man", was an English human billboard in central London in the latter half of the 20th century. One writer called him "the most famous non-famous person in London". According to Lynne Truss, Green became such a ubiquitous figure around Oxford Street in the West End that he was "present in every black-and-white picture of London crowds that one has ever seen".
trending_reason: The Stanley Green article is trending on Wikipedia following the recent surge of interest in his unique legacy as a human billboard and dietary activist, particularly in light of his impact on London's cultural landscape and the release of a new biography.
